intro: Hieracium perissodon, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers with prominent central disk. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Hieracium perissodon is known for its ornamental value and has been cultivated for its attractive foliage and blooms.
